concept.title: About this document
concept.shortdesc: is an open source implementation of the Cryptoki API defined by the Cryptographic Token Interface Standard.

conbody.p: This documentation is intended for the following audience:

manage the so called tokens that are plugged into the framework. They are responsible for adding these tokens to the slots of and, if applicable, for configuring these tokens. They also use either common tools or token-specific tools for administrating the configured tokens.

write programs that exploit the cryptographic services provided by a configured token. The services of such a token either exploit cryptographic hardware or they are also backed by software tokens ().
This documentation is divided into the following parts:

ul.li: describes the architecture and informs about configuration actions that must be performed for all applications that want to exploit these features. Most of the provided information is of interest for both, and .
documents management and key migration tools that are helpful for to enable exploitation through programs.

presents to the documentation of the token-specific mechanisms and information about the contents of a token directory. If a token needs additional token-specific configuration, before it can be accessed by a cryptographic application, find the required information here.

documents the basic structure of applications and presents a simple, but complete code sample for an RSA key pair generation. This part also provides a user scenario showing how to set up a on a server for use from an application on a remote client.
